intro: Schistocarpha steyermarkiana, commonly known as the Steyermark's thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to the central and southern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and prairies. It has small, narrow leaves and produces clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Schistocarpha steyermarkiana is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a short-lived perennial.
